can be considered only as reformed Officers, without any
Command in their Parish, unless in Martial Law, when they
might be appointed on the Staff: the Colonels, when promoted,
should therefore preserve the Command of their Regiments,
and they need not be recommended to the Commander-in-Chief,
as he will be the best Judge of their Merits,
from their Conduct and Character in their Parishes.
Could such Alteration be effected in the Promotion of
the Militia, then would the Exertions of a free People be
distinguished in this Part of the Constitution, System be
preserved, and Men be led and commanded by Officers of
their own Choice!
